alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Holmes; Yazoo (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 14 at 2:59PM CDT until June 14 at 3:15PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL HOLMES...SOUTHWESTERN CARROLL AND NORTHEASTERN YAZOO COUNTIES... At 258 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Black Hawk, or 9 miles north of Lexington, moving east at 60 mph. THIS IS A DESTRUCTIVE STORM FOR Lexington, Ebenezer, Goodman, Durant, and areas in the vicinity. HAZARD...80 mph wind gusts and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged. Expect considerable damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles. Extensive tree damage and power outages are likely. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Holmes, southwestern Carroll and northeastern Yazoo Counties. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...80 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. This storm is producing widespread wind damage across Lexington, Ebenezer, Goodman, Durant, and areas in the vicinity.. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
